    Chord¶

    class base.Chord(nameOrNotes, checkInv=True)[source]¶
    __eq__(chordOrStr)[source]¶

    Return self==value.

    __init__(nameOrNotes, checkInv=True)[source]¶

    Create a chord from chord name or list of notes :param nameOrNotes: chord names or notes within chord

    Examples

    c=Chord(‘Em7’) c=Chord([‘C’,’E’,’G’])

    __repr__()[source]¶

    Return repr(self).

    __str__()[source]¶

    Return str(self).

    __weakref__¶

    list of weak references to the object (if defined)

    avoidNotes(notesOrScale, asStr=False)[source]¶

    Avoid notes are notes one step above a chord note, use sparingly and while passing

    guideTones(asStr=False)[source]¶

    Guide Tones are the 3rd and the 7th of a chord. They are the most harmonically important as they determine its quality, so we want to focus on them. :param asStr: return a string list

    Returns:list of guide tones
    intervals(asStr=False)[source]¶

    Return intervals of the chord :param asStr: if True, returns as strings list, otherwise as list of steps

    listKeys()[source]¶

    Lists the keys on which we have this chord
